13  package org.cesecore.authorization.cache;
14  
15  import java.util.Map;
16  import java.util.Set;
17  import org.apache.log4j.Logger;
18  import org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken;
19  import org.cesecore.authorization.access.AccessSet;
20  import org.cesecore.util.ConcurrentCache;
21  
22  /**
23   * Holds a ConcurrentCache which can be filled with cached AccessSets from
24   * remote systems etc.
25   *
26   * @version $Id: RemoteAccessSetCacheHolder.java 25591 2017-03-23 13:13:02Z
27   *     jeklund $
28   * @deprecated since EJBCA 6.8.0
29   */
30  @Deprecated
31  public final class RemoteAccessSetCacheHolder {
32    /** Logger. */
33    private static final Logger LOG =
34        Logger.getLogger(RemoteAccessSetCacheHolder.class);
35  
36    // These fields are also modified by the test RemoteAccessSetCacheHolderTest
37    /** Last update. */
38    private static volatile int lastUpdate = -1;
39    /** If update is in progress. */
40    private static volatile boolean regularUpdateInProgress = false;
41    // not clear caches etc.
42    /** Semaphore. */
43    private static final Object CHECK_CLEAR_LOCK = new Object();
44    /** Cache. */
45    private static ConcurrentCache<AuthenticationToken, AccessSet> cache =
46        new ConcurrentCache<>();
47  
48    /** Can't be instantiated. */
49    private RemoteAccessSetCacheHolder() { }
50  
51    /**
52     * Returns a ConcurrentCache object that can be used for caching AccessSets
53     * from remote systems. The caller is responsible for filling it with results
54     * from getAccessSetForAuthToken from the remote system, but it's
55     * automatically cleared whenever local access rules change.
56     *
57     * @return Cache
58     */
59    public static ConcurrentCache<AuthenticationToken, AccessSet> getCache() {
60      return cache;
61    }
62  
63    /**
64     * Starts a cache reload. The caller is responsible for actually building the
65     * cache data after calling this method, i.e. building a map of
66     * AuthenticationTokens to AccessSets, and then passing that to
67     * finishCacheReload().
68     *
69     * <p>This method avoids duplicate cache invalidations if invoked multiple
70     * times from multiple sources (e.g. CAs in a cluster that broadcast a "clear
71     * caches" peer message).
72     *
73     * @param updateNumber Access tree update number at the time the clear cache
74     *     triggered.
75     * @return Currently existing AuthenticationTokens in the cache.
76     */
77    public static Set<AuthenticationToken> startCacheReload(
78        final int updateNumber) {
79      LOG.trace(">startCacheReload");
80      synchronized (CHECK_CLEAR_LOCK) {
81        if (updateNumber != -1) {
82          if (lastUpdate >= updateNumber) {
83            LOG.trace(
84                "<startCacheReload " + "(already has a more recent version)");
85            return null;
86          }
87          lastUpdate = updateNumber;
88          regularUpdateInProgress = true;
89          LOG.debug("Started cache reload");
90        } else if (regularUpdateInProgress) {
91          LOG.trace("<startCacheReload (regular update was in progress)");
92          return null;
93        }
94      }
95      final Set<AuthenticationToken> existing = cache.getKeys();
96      LOG.trace("<startCacheReload");
97      return existing;
98    }
99  
100   /**
101    * Complete cache reload.
102    *
103    * @param updateNumber Update
104    * @param newCacheMap New map
105    */
106   public static void finishCacheReload(
107       final int updateNumber,
108       final Map<AuthenticationToken, AccessSet> newCacheMap) {
109     LOG.trace(">finishCacheReload");
110 
111     if (updateNumber != -1) {
112       if (lastUpdate > updateNumber) {
113         LOG.trace(
114             "<finishCacheReload "
115                 + "(not updating because a more recent "
116                 + "update finished earlier)");
117         return;
118       }
119     } else if (regularUpdateInProgress) {
120       LOG.trace(
121           "<finishCacheReload "
122               + "(not updating because regularUpdateInProgress)");
123       return;
124     }
125 
126     // Build new cache, but don't update it yet
127     final ConcurrentCache<AuthenticationToken, AccessSet> newCache =
128         new ConcurrentCache<>(newCacheMap, -1L);
129 
130     // Make sure we don't overwrite a more recent update
131     // (e.g. if it finished faster than us)
132     synchronized (CHECK_CLEAR_LOCK) {
133       if (updateNumber != -1) {
134         if (lastUpdate > updateNumber) {
135           LOG.trace(
136               "<finishCacheReload " + "(already has a more recent version)");
137           return;
138         }
139         lastUpdate = updateNumber;
140         regularUpdateInProgress = false;
141       } else if (regularUpdateInProgress) {
142         LOG.trace("<finishCacheReload " + "(regular update was in progress)");
143         return;
144       }
145       cache = newCache;
146       LOG.debug("Replaced access set cache");
147     }
148     LOG.trace("<finishCacheReload");
149   }
150 
151   /**
152    * Empties the cache. Please try to only use this method with the local cache
153    */
154   public static void forceEmptyCache() {
155     cache.clear();
156   }
157 }
